alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 9:08PM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Claiborne, western Hancock, Grainger, Union and southwestern Lee Counties through 1000 PM EST... At 908 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Noetown to 7 miles southwest of Plainview. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Maynardville, Rutledge, New Tazewell, Tazewell, Plainview, Harrogate, Blaine, Luttrell, Springdale and Lone Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
